Simulation of a compartmental infectious disease transmission model with 3 types of hosts and intervention

Source: R/simulate_schoolclosure_ode.R
simulate_schoolclosure_ode.Rd

This model allows for the simulation of an ID with 3 types of hosts. Groups are assumed to be children, adults and seniors. Intervention can be applied to any of the groups for a certain duration.

simulate_schoolclosure_ode(
  Sc = 1000,
  Ic = 1,
  Sa = 1000,
  Ia = 1,
  Ss = 1000,
  Is = 0,
  bcc = 0.001,
  bca = 0.001,
  bcs = 0.001,
  bac = 0.001,
  baa = 0.001,
  bas = 0.001,
  bsc = 0.001,
  bsa = 0.001,
  bss = 0.001,
  gc = 0.1,
  ga = 0.1,
  gs = 0.1,
  dc = 0.001,
  da = 0.01,
  ds = 0.1,
  c_start = 30,
  c_end = 60,
  c_strength = 0.5,
  c_group = 1,
  tnew = 30,
  tmax = 365
)

Arguments

Sc

: initial number of susceptible children : numeric
Ic

: initial number of infected children : numeric
Sa

: initial number of susceptible adults : numeric
Ia

: initial number of infected adults : numeric
Ss

: initial number of susceptible seniors : numeric
Is

: initial number of infected seniors : numeric
bcc

: rate of transmission from infected child to susceptible child : numeric
bca

: rate of transmission from infected child to susceptible adult : numeric
bcs

: rate of transmission from infected child to susceptible senior : numeric
bac

: rate of transmission from infected adult to susceptible child : numeric
baa

: rate of transmission from infected adult to susceptible adult : numeric
bas

: rate of transmission from infected adult to susceptible senior : numeric
bsc

: rate of transmission from infected senior to susceptible child : numeric
bsa

: rate of transmission from infected senior to susceptible adult : numeric
bss

: rate of transmission from infected senior to susceptible senior : numeric
gc

: rate at which infected children recover or die : numeric
ga

: rate at which infected adults recover or die : numeric
gs

: rate at which infected seniors recover or die : numeric
dc

: fraction of infected children who die : numeric
da

: fraction of infected adults who die : numeric
ds

: fraction of infected seniors who die : numeric
c_start

: start of intervention : numeric
c_end

: end of intervention : numeric
c_strength

: strength of intervention, between 0 and 1 : numeric
c_group

: target group for intervention (1 = children, 2 = adults, 3 = seniors) : numeric
tnew

: time at which new infected adults enter : numeric
tmax

: maximum simulation time, units of months : numeric

Value

This function returns the simulation result as obtained from a call to the deSolve ode solver.

Details

A compartmental ID model with several states/compartments is simulated as a set of ordinary differential equations. The function returns the output from the odesolver as a matrix, with one column per compartment/variable. The first column is time. The model implement basic processes of infection, recovery and death. Treatment is applied, which reduces b by the indicated proportion, during times tstart and tend. At time intervals given by tnew, a new infected individual enters the population. The simulation also monitors the number of infected and when they drop below 1, they are set to 0.

Warning

This function does not perform any error checking. So if you try to do something nonsensical (e.g. any negative values or fractions > 1), the code will likely abort with an error message.

Examples

  # To run the simulation with default parameters just call the function:
  result <- simulate_schoolclosure_ode()
